resources.string: Covid-19 Insight was made in an attempt to increase awareness towards the covid-19 pandemic. Stay safe!
FEVER . HEADACHE . DRY COUGH . FATIGUE . MUSCLE PAIN . SHORTNESS OF BREATH
Through respiratory droplets, when an infected person coughs or sneezes These droplets can land in the mouth or noses of people who are nearby or possibly inhaled into lungs
Through close contact with infected person approximately within 2 metres 0 6 feet or 2 to 3 steps.This can be through hugging, kissing, hand shaking or standing close.
By touching objects and surfaces contaminated by corona virus and then touching the mouth , nose or eyes.
Wash your hands regularly with soap and running water for up to 20 seconds if not available, use an alcohol based sanitizer
Avoid shaking hands, hugging or kissing with people with flu-like symptoms.No visitors unless the person needs to be in your home
Stay in a separate room and use a separate bathroom if available. Avoid sharing household items
Disinfect surfaces and clothing.Ensure surfaces in the household are cleaned and disinfected..Wash this items thoroughly after use.
cough or sneeze into a disposable tissue or bent elbow, and wash hands immediately. Dispose the tissue in a trash or burn it
Person with a cough or sneezing should stay home or keep a social distance and avoid mixing with other crowds
maintain good respiratory hygiene by covering your mouth and nose while coughing and sneezing with a handkerchief, tissue. or into flexed elbow
Wear a face mask to prevent droplet from falling on surfaces
Self isolate if there is chance you might have been exposed
Self isolation of quarantine is an act of individuals who may have been exposed to COVID-19 separating themselves for 14 days to monitor if the develop symptoms.
Anyone who has traveled within the past 14 days to a countryLocal or region with reported COVID-19 cases or has had close contact with a person showing COVID-19 symptoms.
Self isolation help reduce the spread of COVID-19 and reduce the chances of infecting others. We should self isolate as a way of helping others.
If you feel unwell, have a cold or a cough or fever, please call the Helpline assigned to your region , state or countryLocal.
